communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting file number 161-HQ-676, which, according to a FOIA officer at the FBI, contains records relevant to Bill Moyers. Please release the file in full. 

Bill Moyers, the prominent journalist and former White House press secretary. Here is his obituary: https://www.reuters.com/world/us/bill-moyers-broadcaster-lbjs-white-house-press-secretary-dies-91-washington-post-2025-06-26/

Here is the FBI message for your reference https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/fbi-files-bill-moyers-188540/#file-1304428

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Crypto Lotus - SEC (Securities and Exchange Commission)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents on Crypto Lotus, a California-based cryptocurrency hedge fund, which operates the following funds:
* Crypto Lotus Fund A LP (CIK 0001711635)
* Crypto Lotus Fund B, LLC (CIK 0001729101)
* Crypto Lotus Fund B (International), Ltd. (CIK 0001729160)

According to a civil suit, Crypto Lotus was investigated by the SEC sometime in 2019 or 2020 and was then issued a deficiency letter. Please search for this deficiency letter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Silverman

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: SOR and Community Supervision
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer
